text: Thomas Hubert "Tommy" Best (23 December 1920 - 16 September 2018) was a Welsh professional footballer. He was born in Milford Haven, Wales. Best played as a centre forward. He was a veteran of the Second World War, serving in the Royal Navy. He made over 70 appearances in the Football League for Chester, Cardiff City and Queens Park Rangers. Best was the first black professional footballer to play at the top level in Ireland and was also the first black player to appear for Chester in the Football League. Best died on 16 September 2018 in Hereford, Herefordshire from complications of Alzheimer's disease at the age of 97. ==References== Category:1920 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Cardiff City F.C. players Category:Deaths from Alzheimer's disease Category:Queens Park Rangers F.C. players Category:Welsh footballers Category:Military personnel of World War II
